thank you to our partners who celebrated the completion of phase i of the i-80sr-65 interchange improvements project this morning in rocklin final striping for the new lanes will be completed this weekend before opening to motorists!

@cityofroseville mayor allard applauds the completion of the 8065 interchange project which has a regional impact for safety less traffic congestion reduces collisions and fatalities and provides access to top medical facilities in the region for all residents

@pctpa director mike luken discusses the importance of developing infrastructure like the 8065 interchange to transport emergency responders quickly and prepare for emergency response in @placerca in times of need especially in more urban areas

@cityofrocklin mayor patterson highlights the important safety improvements to the interchange benefiting our emergency responders and highway workers 210000 commuters utilize the 8065 interchange daily and many people visit rocklin and roseville as a retail hub

@amarjeetbenipal district 3 caltrans director emphasizes the transportation partnerships that help create vibrant communities and reduce congestion phase i was completed on time and on budget caltrans looks forward to future improvements on this interchange
@california_ctc commissioner konynenburg applauds local and state agencies for their partnership in improving california infrastructure with ambitious projects that keep californians moving

is there a safe temp to leave a dog alone inside a parked car? not really it’s best to leave your pet at home where you know he’s safe if you do need to take your dog along use common sense and pay close attention to outside temperatures and how long he’s been in the car

another reason why it’s a bad idea to leave the car running is if the engine dies the cool air or heat goes away meanwhile a dog is put at risk of becoming too hot or too cold while their owner is unaware there’s a problem

leaving the motor running is a bad idea even if you’ve cracked a window to prevent carbon monoxide poisoning in winter or leave the air conditioning running in the summer an unrestrained pet can accidentally put the car in gear which happened in west virginia

as much as a car can heat up in summer temps it can cool down to under freezing just as fast pets that don’t normally spend a lot of time outside in the winter are more susceptible to the cold when left alone inside a vehicle hypothermia can become a risk at 50 degrees
to understand the heat your pet experiences while waiting in the car sit in it for 10 to 30 minutes with the windows cracked keep in mind your dog is also wearing a fur coat

what temp is safe to leave a dog in the car? when the temp is 70° a car can heat up to 89° in 10 min 104 in 30 at 80° outside you’re looking at 99° inside in 10 minutes & 114 in 30 at 95° it only takes 10 minutes to reach 114° & the temp soars to 129 degrees in 30 minutes

but keeping families there could result in violations of the agreement known as the flores settlement that established standards for the detention of children and limits it to 20 days
there is limited space in the family detention facilities where migrants would be held while the government tries to secure their travel documents which are required to deport them

officials have been nervous about creating scenes of armed agents pulling children from homes and the possibility that some families could be separated another big concern is trafficking children to accompany adults for this purpose
the targeted operation is expected to occur over the course of multiple days and is expected in the coming weeks

the agency has however taken steps in recent days to prepare for mass arrests including requesting the help of homeland security investigative agents who usually conduct long-term investigations into trafficking organizations as opposed to deportations

morgans statement to those seeking asylum through coyotes or cartels is “do not come do not pay the cartels an exorbitant amount of money because once you receive due process and get a final order you will be removed”

among the 2000 warrants are those whose court cases were expedited having typically missed a court date and been ordered deported from the country in absentia they were sent letters in february demanding they report to an immigration and customs office to leave the us
the families are usually released to live with relatives in the united states while their deportation cases go through immigration court

more than 144200 migrants were taken into custody at the border last month the highest monthly total in 13 years many of them seek asylum but only a minority of them ultimately win their cases in immigration courts

the acting director of the immigration and customs enforcement agency mark morgan announced that agents would target more than 2000 immigrant family members who already have deportation orders and failed to report to an immigration agency field office for deportation
an agent cannot simply stop you and demand proof of residency these are individuals who have had warrants placed upon them specifically

cooking a festive feast for the family is not always perfect for those times that your holiday meal doesn’t go as planned make sure there is a fire extinguisher nearby #firesafe4theholiday #12daysofsafety   …

little hands can easily grab a hold of a pot handle if left outward on a stove don’t let the excitement of christmas dinner be ruined by a kitchen accident! avoid a dangerous situation by keeping all pot handles turned inward #12daysofsafety   …

looking to stay warm from the cold winter air by snuggling near a crackling fireplace? the most important #firesafe4theholiday rule is never leave a fire unattended! this of course includes those warm and inviting fireplaces #12daysofsafety   …
be #firesafe4theholiday by testing your carbon monoxide alarms ensure your family is alerted to the invisible danger that can be caused by running fuel burning appliances #12daysofsafety   …
driving to meet up with your family for christmas? drive carefully because winter conditions make for even more dangers on the road #12daysofsafety   …

smoke alarms are extremely important all year long but during the holidays you want to be certain they are in working order a cooking mishap can easily lead to a fire so be #firesafe4theholiday and test them before the festivities begin! #12daysofsafety   …

nothing says christmas like twinkling lights but leaving them on for prolonged periods of time or unattended can bring about unforeseen fire dangers flipping the switch off when you are not around can make your home #firesafe4theholiday #12daysofsafety   …

christmas trees are a staple of holiday decorating but a dry tree can quickly become a fire hazard be #firesafe4theholiday by never letting the water level go below the bottom of the trunk this moisture can increase fire resistance #12daysofsafety   …

an easy switch to make your home #firesafe4theholiday is using led candles instead of traditional candles this is a quick way to prevent a potential disaster and still keep an inviting glow for your holiday guests #12daysofsafety   …

attention to detail is everything when it comes to putting up the perfect holiday decorations don’t let that stop at being #firesafe4theholiday! remember indoor and outdoor lights are different and should stay in their proper area #12daysofsafety   …

part of being #firesafe4theholiday is being mindful of where those fun and festive decorations are placed around your home in case of an emergency you want to be sure that you and your loved ones can easily exit your home #12daysofsafety   …

stay #firesafe4theholiday by tuning in to our #12daysofsafety messages that begin today! to start we recommend keeping a minimum distance of three feet between christmas trees and any source of heat   …
